resources.string: Invalid GSI size, switched to default (%1$s)
Invalid Userdata size, switched to default (%1$s)

Proceed with installation?

Selected GSI: %1$s
Userdata size: %2$sGB
GSI file size: %3$s
The file you choose isn\'t supported, only xz, gz and img files are supported
Extracting gzip file, so we can get image file size (Needed by DSU command line)…
Compressing image file into gzip format (DSU need a image within gzip)…
GSI is being installed, check your notifications to see progress!\nTo install other GSI, open this app again!
Select a GSI file to be installed
Supported formats are: xz, gz and img
Default is set to %1$dGB, uncheck to change
If you currently have a Dynamic System installed (or being installed), DISCARD before installing other GSI, otherwise, it will fail
To start installation on non-rooted devices, you need to run this command on adb shell:
If you\'re running adb shell without PC (eg: LADB, Shizuku\'s Rish, WebADB, Bugjaeger..), you can remove adb shell, and run it directly:
Once it\'s done, check your notifications to follow installation process, you can also close this app
Your device does not support dynamic partitions (DSU depends on dynamic partitions)

You seem to be running a Custom OS that spoofs bootloader status, you need UNLOCKED bootloader to boot most of GSIs, remember to unlock yours if isn\'t yet\nAlso, compatibility with Custom ROMs aren\'t guaranteed
You need UNLOCKED bootloader to boot most GSI via DSU\nRemember to unlock yours if isn\'t yet
You seem to be running a Custom OS, compatibility with Custom ROMs aren\'t guaranteed
Once GSI is ready, you will need to run a command on ADB to start GSI via DSU installation
Magisk have been tested, and works fine with DSU on newest versions :)
We do not tested this app, or DSU feature on other root solutions than Magisk, but you should be fine
You need to select a folder to be used as our application storage (necessary to store temporary files)\n\nPlease select or create a new folder and allow access.
You have less than 40% of free storage, installation process will fail, free up some space

Magisk version unsupported

Your Magisk code version: %1$d
Required code version: 23018 or higher
Show logs after invoking DSU installation activity
In GB, values applies when app restart
Always use Auto, not recommended changing
Simple app that helps you installing GSIs via DSU\'s feature.\n\n 2022 - VegaBobo
You\'re running a debug build.\nDSU Sideloader %1$s (%2$d)
Copying gz file into our folder…

DSU (Dynamic System Updates), is a feature introduced in Android 10, allowing developers to test Android system images, without touching device partitions, with Android 11, DSU can also replace multiple partitions.
Progress done till now will be gone, are you sure?
DSU Sideloader will set this parameter for you automatically, setting image size manually is strongly inadvisable.

GSI daemon is trying to allocate in external SD, but it fails for some reason (likely due sepolicy denials)
To fix that, you can install DSU Sideloader Magisk's module, or temporary eject sd to avoid this (you can set this option permanently in preferences).

Error: %1$s
Android requires, at least 40% of free storage to proceed installation, free up some space and try again.\n\nError: %1$s

Your kernel may be registering f2fs in different path, that one expected from GSI daemon 
To fix that, you can try to install DSU Sideloader Magisk's module, or change kernel.

Error: %1$s

Looks like SELinux is blocking GSI daemon to work due denials, this error is common devices running Android 10
 To fix that, you can try to install DSU Sideloader Magisk's module, or set SELinux to permissive.
** Changing to permissive will weakens your device security.

Error: %1$s

On Android 10 devices, images/filesystem needs to have more than 512 extents.
 To fix that, you can try to install DSU Sideloader Magisk's module.

Error: %1$s
READ_LOGS permission is required, use Shizuku to allow it?\nAfter granting permission, application needs to be reopened.
A GSI is already installed, discard to continue?\n\n**All data present in DSU will be deleted.
Installation prompt invoked, waiting user confirmation to proceed..
Dismissed installation prompt? waiting for too long? try pressing "try again", it will invoke installation prompt one more time.
Image installed successfully, check your notifications to boot into dynamic system
All data present in installed DSU will be DELETED after discarding, are you sure?
Faster, use internal APIs to install images directly
This feature is under testing, and may be unstable, are you sure?

DSU Sideloader requires READ_LOGS permission (allows logcat reading)
It will be used to obtain installation progress and diagnose errors in DSU installation.

**After granting permission, application needs to be reopened
Waiting service to grant permission, please wait…
